DataElement.preferredName: Anal High Grade Squamous Intraepithelial Neoplasia Disease Biopsy Confirmed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date a perianal high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion (HSIL) was confirmed by biopsy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Anal High Grade Squamous Intraepithelial Neoplasia Disease Biopsy Confirmed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to confirmation by biopsy (removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body) of perianal (having to do with the anus, which is the posterior opening of the large bowel) high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion (HSIL; a precancerous neoplastic process characterized by the presence of moderate or severe dysplastic cytological changes which extend to the upper part of the squamous epithelium) disease.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Anal High Grade Squamous Intraepithelial Neoplasia Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the anus, which is the posterior opening of the large bowel.:A precancerous neoplastic process characterized by the presence of moderate or severe dysplastic cytological changes which extend to the upper part of the squamous epithelium.  Maturation at the surface of the squamous epithelium may or may not be present.  Representative examples include the high grade esophageal squamous intraepithelial neoplasia, high grade cervical squamous intraepithelial neoplasia, high grade vaginal intraepithelial neoplasia, and high grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the anus, which is the posterior opening of the large bowel.

A precancerous neoplastic process characterized by the presence of moderate or severe dysplastic cytological changes which extend to the upper part of the squamous epithelium.  Maturation at the surface of the squamous epithelium may or may not be present.  Representative examples include the high grade esophageal squamous intraepithelial neoplasia, high grade cervical squamous intraepithelial neoplasia, high grade vaginal intraepithelial neoplasia, and high grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Confirmed; having been established or verified.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
